patterns_discovered.description: The __init__.py file uses a barrel/index pattern to centralize model imports and exports, making them available via a single import point
Imports are organized by model module (user, construction, approval, area, file, audit, checklist_template) and exported in matching order in __all__
Single module imports can export multiple related model classes (e.g., ChecklistTemplate, ChecklistSubSection, ChecklistItemTemplate)

gotchas_discovered.description: The __all__ list does not maintain alphabetical order; items are ordered by module import order rather than alphabetically
gotchas_discovered.impact: May cause inconsistency if developers expect alphabetical ordering in exports

gotchas_discovered.description: checklist_template module import is appended after audit module rather than being inserted in alphabetical order
gotchas_discovered.impact: Import order is import-chronological rather than alphabetical, could confuse maintainers

approach_outcome.description: Successfully added imports and exports for three new checklist-related model classes to the centralized models __init__.py file

recommendations.suggestion: Consider maintaining alphabetical order in both imports and __all__ exports for consistency and easier navigation
recommendations.reasoning: Would improve discoverability and reduce merge conflicts when multiple developers add models simultaneously

recommendations.suggestion: Verify that ChecklistTemplate, ChecklistSubSection, and ChecklistItemTemplate are properly defined in app/models/checklist_template.py
recommendations.reasoning: Import success depends on these classes being correctly implemented in the source module

recommendations.suggestion: Ensure imports can be resolved by testing: from app.models import ChecklistTemplate, ChecklistSubSection, ChecklistItemTemplate
recommendations.reasoning: Validates that the barrel export pattern works correctly for the new models
